result.execSummary:
The defendant Maurice M Hines was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Damage to Property, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Maurice M Hines
Current: 4421 N 44th Street, Milwaukee, WI 53218 United States  (Effective: 06-15-2017)
Prior: 5122 North 47th Street, Milwaukee, WI 53218

Defendant Maurice M Hines in court with attorney Gabriela A Leija.  Defendant Maurice M Hines in custody.  Ian Franklin Vance-Curzan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant. 

As to Count 1:
The Court ordered defendant to serve 30 days in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 4 days time served, STRAIGHT TIME. 

Court ordered defendant to provide a DNA sample and pay the DNA surcharge.

Court ordered defendant to pay all applicable court costs and fees by 6/1/2017, or to be docketed as a civil judgment/tax intercept.

Filed;
-Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
-Pretrial Incarceration Credit.

Defendant Maurice M Hines in court with attorney Gabriela A Leija.  Jessica Bellows appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: KAR.
State advised the Court they have complied with the Victims' Rights Law.  Negotiations placed on the record by the state.

AS TO COUNT 1: Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire, addendum and jury instructions received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the criminal complaint and ordered a judgment of conviction be entered on the record.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.

AS TO COUNT 2:  Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the state, Court ordered count dismissed and read-in to case for the purposes of sentencing.

Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 21.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 1, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Maurice M Hines in court with attorney Gabriela A Leija.  Jessica Bellows appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: KAR.
Case calendared for calendar call.  Court ordered stayed bench warrant lifted.  Defense is ready to proceed to plea.  Case passed.

Attorney Gabriela A Leija in court.  Jessica Bellows appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a bench warrant issued but stayed the issuance until 4/25/2016.  Calendar call scheduled for April 25, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Maurice M Hines in court with attorney Gabriela A Leija.  Margaret Anne Kunisch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Newly appointed. Received discovery and offer.  Defendant texting the victim. Court admonished the Defendant. Court ordered Defendant to follow all conditions of bail to include the NO CONTACT ORDER REGARDING THE VICTIM during the pendency of this case.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 14, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services "Court Reminders."  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings. Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Defendant advised No Contact Order remains in full force and effect.  Defendant to have no contact with Lynette F. and 4722 North 49th Street Lower, Milwaukee, WI 53218.

Defendant Maurice M Hines in court with attorney Patrick Flanagan.  Defendant Maurice M Hines in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: AMI  
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Reserve Judge, Branch 04.  All parties are notified that effective March 7, 2016, this case will be assigned to the Honorable Cynthia Davis, Branch 21, in Room 515 of the Courthouse.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 14, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Signature bond ordered to be forfeited in the amount of 250.00.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE BENCH  WARRANT.
Attorney Mark Allan Dluzak in court.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Violation Report received and filed.
Received & Filed, Justice Point Report.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Violation Report (missed office contact)  received and filed.

Defendant Maurice M Hines in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Morgan Wills, appears as intern for the state under the student practice rule under the supervision of  Sarah McNutt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Pretrial conference held. Defense requests a plea/sentencing date.  Parties are notified that effective August 3, 2015 this case will be reassigned per rotation to Judge Lindsey Grady, Branch 23 in Courthouse room 515.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 24, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Lynetter F. or her residence

Defendant Maurice M Hines in court with attorney Vincent Paul Guimont.  Defendant Maurice M Hines in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Reserve Judge, Branch 45.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 30, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
